author: gstein
msg: Remove read-only uses of the svn_wc__open_text_base() function. These can
all be replaced by the public svn_wc_get_pristine_contents() function.
Note: optimized away one reference to get_empty_file() in diff.c. We
should keep an empty file sitting around somewhere, rather than create
(struct handler_baton): no need to keep file references to the source
and target. they will be closed when the streams are closed.
(window_handler): no need to manually close the files
(apply_textdelta): arrange logic to open a (source) stream rather than a
file, then pass that straight into the svn_txdelta_apply() call. for
the target, open a file, but don't bother to store in the baton --
pass ownership into the stream we'll wrap around it.
(struct file_baton): no need to keep file references; let the streams
(window_handler): don't worry about closing the files. the
stream-closure will take care of them.
(apply_textdelta): arrange to open streams for svn_txdelta_apply() and
for any file handles: let the stream take ownership rather than
(svn_wc_transmit_text_deltas2): arrange to open streams instead of

msg: Note: APR or our function may need to change signatures to clean this up

author: gstein
msg: All callers of svn_wc__close_text_base() passed FALSE for the sync flag,
which meant that it devolved to a simple file close. Throw out all the
crap, and just close the file.

author: arfrever
msg: * win-tests.py: Use str.split() instead of string.split().

author: arfrever
msg: Use str.lower() and str.upper() instead of string.lower() and string.upper().
